questions.question: Which command will show the first 20 lines of a file?

options.A: A pipeline stage that deals with branch instructions
options.B: A type of cache memory with larger capacity
options.C: Processors capable of executing multiple instructions per clock cycle
options.D: An advanced type of interrupt handling mechanism

questions.question: Which command is used to send a signal to a running process in Unix/Linux?

options.A: To store frequently used instructions for quick access

What will be printed by the following code?
int main() {
    int i;
    for (i = 0; i < 5; i++);
    printf("%d", i);
}

What is the output of this code?
int main() {
    int a = 10, b = 20, c = 30;
    int *p = &b;
    printf("%d", *(p + 1));
}

What is the output of the following program?

void main() {
    int x = 0;
    for (; x < 10; x++) {
        if (x % 2 == 0)
            continue;
        printf("%d ", x);
    }
    printf("%d ", x);
}

What will be the output of the following code?

union test {
    int i;
    float f;
};

int main() {
    union test t;
    t.i = 10;
    t.f = 20.5;
    printf("%d %.2f\n", t.i, t.f);
    return 0;
}

Consider the following code:


struct person {
    char name[50];
    int age;
    float salary;
};

int main() {
    struct person p1 = {"John", 30, 55000.5};
    struct person *ptr = &p1;

    printf("%s %d %.2f\n", ptr->name, ptr->age, ptr->salary);
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

void main() {
    int x = 5;
    int *ptr = &x;
    printf("%d", (*ptr)++);
    printf("%d", x);
}

What will be the output of the following code?


int main() {
    FILE *fp;
    int count = 0;
    fp = fopen("test.txt", "r");
    while (fgetc(fp) != EOF) {
        count++;
    }
    fclose(fp);
    printf("Number of characters: %d\n", count);
    return 0;
}
Assume "test.txt" contains "Hello\nWorld".
Which of the following statements is true about fputc in C?

options.A: fputc writes a string to a file.
options.B: fputc writes a single character to a file.
options.C: fputc reads a single character from a file.

questions.question: What does the command 'du -sh *' display?

options.A: Detailed usage statistics of all files.
options.C: Size of each file and directory in human-readable format.
options.D: Disk usage summary of all files and directories.

questions.question:
What is the output of the following program?

void main() {
    int x = 5;
    int *ptr = &x;
    *ptr += 2;
    printf("%d", x);
}

What will be printed by the following code?

using namespace std;

class Base {
public:
    virtual void print() {
        cout << "Base ";
    }
};

class Derived : public Base {
public:
    void print() override {
        cout << "Derived ";
    }
};

int main() {
    Base* ptr = new Derived;
    ptr->print();
    delete ptr;
    return 0;
}

What will be the output of the following code snippet?

using namespace std;

void fun(int a, float b = 3.14) {
    cout << "int and float: " << a << ", " << b << endl;
}

void fun(int a) {
    cout << "int: " << a << endl;
}

int main() {
    fun(5);
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

using namespace std;

class Base {
public:
    Base() {
        cout << "Base ";
    }
};

class Derived : public Base {
public:
    Derived() {
        cout << "Derived ";
    }
};

int main() {
    Derived d;
    return 0;
}

Consider the following code snippet:

using namespace std;

int x = 10;

void func() {
    extern int x;
    x = 20;
    cout << x << " ";
}

int main() {
    cout << x << " ";
    func();
    cout << x << endl;
    return 0;
}
Which command is used to search for a string in all files under a directory, including subdirectories?

What will be the output of the following program?

using namespace std;

class A {
public:
    virtual void func() {
        cout << "A ";
    }
};

class B : public A {
public:
    void func() override {
        cout << "B ";
    }
};

int main() {
    A a;
    B b;
    A* ptr = &b;
    ptr->func();
    return 0;
}

What will be the output of the following program?

using namespace std;

template<typename T>
class MyClass {
public:
    T value;
    MyClass(T val) : value(val) {}
    void print() {
        cout << value << " ";
    }
};

int main() {
    MyClass<int> obj1(5);
    MyClass<double> obj2(3.14);
    obj1.print();
    obj2.print();
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

using namespace std;

class Base {
public:
    virtual void print() {
        cout << "Base ";
    }
};

class Derived : public Base {
public:
    void print() override {
        cout << "Derived ";
    }
};

int main() {
    Base obj = Derived();
    obj.print();
    return 0;
}

What will be the output of the following program?

using namespace std;

class A {
public:
    A() {
        cout << "A ";
    }
};

class B {
public:
    B() {
        cout << "B ";
    }
};

class C : public A, public B {
public:
    C() {
        cout << "C ";
    }
};

int main() {
    C c;
    return 0;
}

What will be the output of the following program?

using namespace std;

class A {
public:
    virtual void func() {
        cout << "A ";
    }
};

class B : public A {
public:
    void func() override {
        cout << "B ";
    }
};

int main() {
    A* ptr = new B;
    B* bptr = dynamic_cast<B*>(ptr);
    if (bptr) {
        bptr->func();
    }
    delete ptr;
    return 0;
}

questions.question: In the context of SQL, what is a 'subquery'?

options.A: A query that is executed in parallel with another query.
options.B: A query nested within another query.
options.C: A query that retrieves data from multiple tables.
options.D: A query that modifies data in a database.

options.B: To analyze the code structure without executing it
options.C: To verify the software's compliance with coding standards
options.D: To execute the software and test its behavior

options.A: Reading uncommitted changes from another transaction
options.B: Reading committed changes from another transaction
options.C: Reading changes only after they are committed
options.D: Reading changes from a terminated transaction

questions.question: What is the key difference between a hub and a switch in terms of how they handle network traffic?

options.B: A hub filters incoming data based on IP addresses, while a switch filters based on domain names.
options.C: A hub encrypts data packets before forwarding, while a switch decrypts data at the destination.
options.D: A hub performs error checking on data packets, while a switch focuses on routing decisions.
